lessons.japanese: 何もかも洗いざらい言ってしまえ。
lessons.indonesian: You had better tell me the whole story.

lessons.japanese: いざという時のために備えておかないとね。
lessons.indonesian: You must provide for a rainy day.

lessons.japanese: いざという時は、いつでもあいつを頼ればいいからな。
lessons.indonesian: You can always count on him in any emergency.

lessons.japanese: たとえばあなたの家庭のいざこざを考えてごらんなさい。
lessons.indonesian: Take, for instance, your family problems.

lessons.japanese: そのお金はいざというときのために取っておくよ。
lessons.indonesian: I'm going to lay aside that money for emergencies.

lessons.japanese: いざこざも全部片付いて、やれやれです。
lessons.indonesian: I felt relieved when all the troubles were taken care of.

lessons.japanese: おじさんは今週うちにたいざいしている。
lessons.indonesian: My uncle is staying with us this week.

lessons.japanese: いざ踊るとなるとマイケルジャクソンの右にでるものはいない。
lessons.indonesian: When it comes to dancing, nobody can move like Michael Jackson.

lessons.japanese: いざ投票という時、彼は棄権した。
lessons.indonesian: When it was time to vote, he abstained.

lessons.japanese: いざとなれば勇気が湧いてくる。
lessons.indonesian: Your courage will come out in a crisis.

lessons.japanese: いざとなったら勇気が無くなった。
lessons.indonesian: My courage failed me at the crucial moment.

lessons.japanese: いざとなったら、傘が武器の代用になる。
lessons.indonesian: My umbrella will serve for a weapon, should the occasion arise.
